title: Monstrous demonspawn
data:

|   |                                                                                                                                   |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A half-mortal, half-demonic creature, with its hellish heritage asserting itself through a certain devilish cast to its features. |

## Useful Info

**Monstrous demonspawn** are demonspawn with several melee attacks and more hit points than other demonspawn. They can be found in the [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium").

## Tips & Tricks

Since they don't have ranged attacks unless they find or generate with a ranged weapon, [kiting](/Kiting "Kiting") them and using powerful ranged spells works well. If you end up in melee, high level [fighters](/Fighter "Fighter") shouldn't have too much trouble, but low [XL](/XL "XL") characters should stick with spells and ranged weapons. If you end up in melee range, use a [potion of might](/Potion_of_might "Potion of might") if you have one, and use your heal wounds potions or wands on yourself as needed. [Berserking](/Berserk "Berserk") isn't usually a good idea since they have a large amount of [HP](/HP "HP"). Like all demonspawn, they are also vulnerable to holy weapons and [silver](/Silver "Silver"), so use those if you have them.

## History

- Monstrous demonspawn were removed in [0.28](/0.28 "0.28").
- Monstrous demonspawn were added in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14").
html:
Monstrous demonspawn

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

For a list of all demonspawn, see list of demonspawn.

monstrous demonspawn 6 
HP 66-133
HD 10
XP 956
Speed 10
AC 9
EV 8
Will 40
Attack1 20 (hit: plain)
Attack2 15 (claw: plain)
Attack3 15 (gore: plain)
Resistances rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Silver
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type demonspawn, monstrous demonspawn
Flags
See invisible
Speaks
Warm-blooded
No poly
A half-mortal, half-demonic creature, with its hellish heritage asserting itself through a certain devilish cast to its features.


Useful Info

Monstrous demonspawn are demonspawn with several melee attacks and more hit points than other demonspawn. They can be found in the Pandemonium.

Tips & Tricks

Since they don't have ranged attacks unless they find or generate with a ranged weapon, kiting them and using powerful ranged spells works well. If you end up in melee, high level fighters shouldn't have too much trouble, but low XL characters should stick with spells and ranged weapons. If you end up in melee range, use a potion of might if you have one, and use your heal wounds potions or wands on yourself as needed. Berserking isn't usually a good idea since they have a large amount of HP. Like all demonspawn, they are also vulnerable to holy weapons and silver, so use those if you have them.

History

  • Monstrous demonspawn were removed in 0.28.
  • Monstrous demonspawn were added in 0.14.

==Useful Info==
'''Monstrous demonspawn''' are demonspawn with several melee attacks and more hit points than other demonspawn. They can be found in the [[Pandemonium]].

==Tips & Tricks==

Since they don't have ranged attacks unless they find or generate with a ranged weapon, [[kiting]] them and using powerful ranged spells works well. If you end up in melee, high level [[fighter]]s shouldn't have too much trouble, but low [[XL]] characters should stick with spells and ranged weapons. If you end up in melee range, use a [[potion of might]] if you have one, and use your heal wounds potions or wands on yourself as needed. [[Berserk]]ing isn't usually a good idea since they have a large amount of [[HP]]. Like all demonspawn, they are also vulnerable to holy weapons and [[silver]], so use those if you have them.

==History==
*Monstrous demonspawn were removed in [[0.28]].
*Monstrous demonspawn were added in [[0.14]].
